{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3474751,"name":"Jason Rubenstein","username":"jruben4","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jruben4/{size}/169941_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-08T00:51:00.114Z","cooked":"

I believe you can plug a webcam into the limelight and access it’s feed in the cameraserver. Can you set up the webcam as the input to one of the pipelines? I can only see “camera” (the built-in camera) and “snapshot” as options for pipeline inputs on both the limelight 2+ and 3.

No, I don’t believe you can. We regularly use that feature for a driver camera but don’t do any processing on it.

From the LL documentation:

docs.limelightvision.io

Python SnapScript Pipelines | Limelight Documentation

With python scripting, you can utilize the full power of OpenCV to rapidly build your own pipelines. The python interpreter is baked

I wonder if that includes OpenCV ability to read its own IP camera which would be the URL of the LL stream of the USB camera?
